p: Similarly, the two bat-derived SARSr-CoV (SL-CoVZC45 and SL-CoVZXC21) isolated from Zhoushan and Nanjing in China are not direct ancestors of the 2019-nCoV despite the fact there is high identity at genome sequence level. Recombination events in bats and an unknown intermediate host especially in the ORF1b region and S gene have led to the evolution of current virulent 2019-nCoV strains (Wu et al. 2020).
